name: Worksheet on HBase
body:
# Installation
## Installing Java
1. sudo apt-get install python-software-properties
2. sudo apt-get install software-properties-common
2. sudo add-apt-repository ppa:webupd8team/java
3. sudo apt-get update
4. sudo apt-get install oracle-java7-installer

## Installing HBase
1. wget http://apache.claz.org/hbase/stable/hbase-1.1.4-bin.tar.gz
2. tar xfvz hbase-1.1.4-bin.tar.gz
3. sudo mkdir /usr/lib/hbase
4. sudo mv hbase-1.1.4/ /usr/lib/hbase
5. We need to change the JAVA_HOME directory. Open the start script with "sudo nano /usr/lib/hbase/hbase-1.1.4/conf/hbase-env.sh". Then find the line that read "# export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/jdk1.6.0/" and change it to "export JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/java-6-openjdk-amd64/". Please note how I removed the # in addition to changing the directory.
6. Now open your .bashrc file with "nano ~/.bashrc" and add the following line at the end "export HBASE_HOME=/usr/lib/hbase/hbase-1.1.4". Then save this file and exit nano.
7. Now type "bash" and hit enter.

## Configuring HBase
Now type "sudo nano $HBASE_HOME/conf/hbase-site.xml" and change the entire file so it looks like:
```
<?xml version="1.0"?>
<?xml-stylesheet type="text/xsl" href="configuration.xsl"?>
<!--

 * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
 * WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
 * See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
 * limitations under the License.
 */
-->
<configuration>
<property>

<name>hbase.rootdir</name>

<value>file:///home/hduser/HBASE/hbase</value>

</property>

<property>

<name>hbase.zookeeper.property.dataDir</name>

<value>/home/hduser/HBASE/zookeeper</value>

</property>
</configuration>
```

# Starting hbase
1. sudo $HBASE_HOME/bin/start-hbase.sh
2. sudo $HBASE_HOME/bin/hbase shell

# Questions
1. Create a table called wiki like we did in lecture with a single family column called text.
2. Add two pages (rows). One called Home and one called DATA210. Make the value of the text family column for Home be "Welcome to Wiki!" and make the text family column for DATA210 be "Data 210 syllabus".
3. Now modify the table wiki to include the revisions column as we did in class. NOTE: The alter statements in the notes are broken up over two lines.
4. Now add revision information of your choosing to each row so we can track who made a change to the wiki and what comment they left behind. Make up the data.
